definitions.text: something kept back or saved for future use or a special purpose
an athlete who plays only when a starter on the team is replaced
(medicine) potential capacity to respond in order to maintain vital functions
a district that is reserved for particular purpose
armed forces that are not on active duty but can be called in an emergency
the trait of being uncommunicative; not volunteering anything more than necessary
hold back or set aside, especially for future use or contingency
examples: they held back their applause in anticipation

definitions.text: give or assign a resource to a particular person or cause
examples: I will earmark this money for your research
She sets aside time for meditation every day

definitions.text: obtain or arrange (for oneself) in advance
examples: We managed to reserve a table at Maxim's

definitions.text: arrange for and reserve (something for someone else) in advance
examples: reserve me a seat on a flight
The agent booked tickets to the show for the whole family
please hold a table at Maxim's
